Sentencas: This paper addresses the damage and fracture issues of glass and ceramic materials used in solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Crack growth in solid oxide fuel cell materials: From discrete to continuum damage modeling

Sentencas: Analyses of an internal crack and of an interface crack between dissimilar materials were conducted using a modified boundary layer modeling approach.
Titulo: Crack growth in solid oxide fuel cell materials: From discrete to continuum damage modeling

Sentencas: In this approach, fracture is allowed to occur in a small process window situated at an initial crack tip.
Titulo: Crack growth in solid oxide fuel cell materials: From discrete to continuum damage modeling

Sentencas: Elastic displacement crack-tip fields are prescribed as remote boundary conditions.
Titulo: Crack growth in solid oxide fuel cell materials: From discrete to continuum damage modeling

Sentencas: Crack propagation was first modeled discretely.
Titulo: Crack growth in solid oxide fuel cell materials: From discrete to continuum damage modeling

Sentencas: Next, a continuum damage mechanics (CDM) model for brittle materials was developed to capture damage and crack growth in the process window.
Titulo: Crack growth in solid oxide fuel cell materials: From discrete to continuum damage modeling

Sentencas: In particular, the damage model was applied to a glass-ceramic material that had been developed in-house for sealing purposes.
Titulo: Crack growth in solid oxide fuel cell materials: From discrete to continuum damage modeling

Sentencas: Discrete and continuum damage solutions were then compared.
Titulo: Crack growth in solid oxide fuel cell materials: From discrete to continuum damage modeling

Sentencas: Finally, the CDM model was used to determine the crack propagation direction as a function of a mode mixity measure.
Titulo: Crack growth in solid oxide fuel cell materials: From discrete to continuum damage modeling
